title: Cochlear implant
summary: A cochlear implant (CI) is a surgically implanted neuroprosthesis that provides a person who has bilateral moderate-to-profound sensorineural hearing loss with sound perception and an opportunity with intenisve therapy for improved speech understanding in both quiet and noise.[1][2]A CI bypasses acoustic hearing by direct electrical stimulation of the auditory nerve.[2] Through everyday listening and intensive auditory training, both children and adults may learn to interpret those signals as speech and sound.[3][4][5]
